content.label: Highly efficient for team work!
It's a fast easy way to encourage the teams.

Original complaint was lack of 3rd party keyboard support. That has since been fixed. 

Now I'd like to see giphy support like the Android app.

Solid app.
Amazing

title.label: Great app, makes business an absolute breeze to handle.

content.label: Very happy.

Every aspect of staying in the loop with all team members & projects have been encompassed in this awesome app! Thank you Glip! And dare I mention all for FREE!!! - Not saying not to upgrade - but what a solution to get results right off the ground running!

Very promising, nicely designed, very functional, free collaboration app! Love the desktop app too, and the integration to Google Drive and others. I like the innovative in-context commenting on Notes and Pictures.

Some features are still missing though, like threaded replies. Also, authentication is overly minimalistic, team members get all or nothing access. Another dangerously missing feature is Note history, without it an accidentally deleted/modified note cannot be recovered.
Lets see encryption
great app
Such a great way to stay connected at work and on the go!
Easy to use and keeps my team in sync
It works ok. Sometimes I don't get notified when I have new messages on the app.
Glip is a fantastic app but doesn't make noises when you get new messages on mobile.
What Glyngster says. We have been following the developer team way before they were aquired by RingCentral. App is serious win, hands down.

What an awesome collaboration tool!  
It's continually being updated with new enhancements that make it even more useful!
As people in our organization see the efficiency of the communication and collaboration they want in. It is intuitive and easy to get people added and up to speed.  It is also easy to customize.

title.label: How could you not love this

content.label:
We too ditched Slack in favor of greater flexibility and tasks. Seems like such a simple thing to have (tasks) but it makes all the difference. Tasks and events show up in the calendar which is incredibly helpful.

We also love the ability to create folders for a team where you have various groups. Helps keep things very organized.

The iPhone app has greatly improved, hopefully in a future release they give you the ability to comment on a task, right now this is only possible on the desktop version.

We love Glip!

Our company ditched Slack for Glip.

And we never looked back. 

You can rename teams, toggle from public to private; it has a built-in task manager, calendar, URL and file repositories, and integrates with pretty much any enterprise system under the sun. 

And if you're on RingCentral (which you should be), it integrates with your voip solution. 

RingCentral & Glip are our one-stop communications platforms for our business. What an exciting time to be alive!
I could not get through the day without Glip. It is my communication hub.
I have used many tools and apps and this is the best one I've used by far.
Very useful for collaborating with my coworkers
Great way to stay on top of work conversations when I'm out of the office!
This works as my communications hub, with IM meetings and phone all in one. Countless features and integrations are also included.

I tried different IM for our business but finally settled for GLIP. Since last one year we are using between 400+ team members and this is the best communication solution we get for our team. Better then slack / skype / mattermost  etc.
Love the flexibility and the ease of use!

It's easy to use. We have had some issues with connectivity but it's been good overall. Sometimes the server will be down and we cannot connect. Only happened about 3-4 times since we started using this a few months ago.

Love this app. We have been testing out a number of different options for work, and this is the first one that seems to do everything we want, in a package that is easy to pick up. 

In the future it would be really cool to see more integration with iCloud reminders and calendars on iOS!
Great app by it self. If combined with RingCentral mobile app further adds value.

Glip is by far the best collaboration tool I've ever used. I'm in technology sales and have tested many collaboration, instant messaging and presence tool but nobody compares to Glip. Glip gives you the ability to create groups (internal and/or external contacts) while being able to file share. Glip also archives conversations so you can go back and search for key words to find information faster. Anybody who is looking for a new collaboration tool for your company, I strongly suggest looking into Glip!
We run all internal communications through Glip. Better than Slack because you categorize, task, and add notes in more granular way. It's been rock solid.

Use in house at RingCentral, and have seen many others using around the country. It's taking off quickly because it combines instant messaging, voice, video conferencing, and team collaboration all in one app!

I have tried all of them - from Slack to HipChat and more than twenty others. Glip is hands down the best offering - absolutely love be features and it's MUCH cheaper (even free) than e.g. Slack. It really is that good!

title.label: Can't Believe How Much Better Than BaseCamp

content.label: This comes free with RingCentral. I have a BackOffice of six that uses RingCentral then we all use Glip. We even have the techs on Glip. Didn't go so well with BaseCamp and  Glip is free and it's a killer app not to mention my BackOffcie is spread all over the world, crazy how smooth this thing works.

Glip has changed the way I work.  It has allowed me to increase my productivity.  It's intuitive, and feature rich. I don't know how I got work done without it.  Everyone in the office loves "Gliping".
Would have given it five stars but they need reminders with their tasks

There is no downside with this tool - on top of being a great chat and communication tool, it has great calendar and task management capabilities, stronger than what I've seen with others on the market, it's a great all-in-one collaboration tool, I am a fan and I hope they continue to build on its capabilities.

There are free tool that do much more than this generic msgs app.

Ring central has lost their focus — and I for one am completely aggravated that they insist on pushing glip on their customers.
Really starting to love this since an employee of Ringcentral turned me onto it but why are Notes not available on the app?
Yes!
I have used this app for a while now as a free slack. It is almost there but we have had no issues

We use Glip as our main means of communicating with in our company. It is quicker and easier than email and also gives us the ability to add attachments to our posts. The task feature is extremely helpful in managing our projects.  The functionality of the app is identical to the web browser version of the program, which is not the case for competitor applications. I highly recommend this app!

title.label: Need ability to comment in specific tasks threads

content.label:
The app has come light-years from where it originally started, so great work there to the team. But the inability to comment directly in a task thread, makes it very hard to use correctly. When posing on mobile it only goes to the entire 'team thread', and that totally messes up the work flow (especially as I try to teach others how to use the commenting correctly). 

If that change is made, 5/5 stars, no problem.

Love everything about the app but it's very stupid how in the mobile app when you go to add something into the calendar it does not ask you who you want to see it like the computer version does... please fix this and I will make it 5 stars

This app is horrible. They removed crucial functionality a year ago when they did a rewrite. It's still missing. 

Support is horrible. I have reported multiple bugs and they haven't been addressed, many months later. 

RingCentral's services are pretty good, but Glip is the unfortunate exception.

Glip is an okay app. Great for the cost. It is a basic communication tool that allows our business to keep communication mostly centralized. The calendar leaves very much to be desired and so far does not appear to be linkable. The messenger part is great and security has been acceptable.

Updated

While you can't add files directly from the app you can now add them from other apps and the interface allows you to specify the project and/or recipient for the file and add a message. With this addition 5 stars!

Prior to adopting Glip late last year, we used slack for our team daily communications and Sococo for audio/video presentations and meetings. Glip replace both of those tools and so far is a superior solution. It is not perfect and does experience glitches from time to time. The recent addition of capability to read MS Office files direct within Glip is a nice improvement. Overall Glip works extremely well. I agree with other reviews that the integration between Glip and the Ring Central app could be better. Since their development team does seem to listen to the user base, I am sure that it is on their radar.
The most superior team collab app available - beats slack hands down
Great app for inter-company communications. I highly recommend it.

title.label: Glip is The best collaboration/messaging app

content.label:
It has so many more bells and whistles for true collaboration then slack or hip chat not to mention the 80 other mediocre products. 

You have the ability to share notes, tasks and you can do a video call. it's great for teams as well. It really keeps me on track with what I need to do and the instant messaging is fantastic because you can put in at sign in front of persons name and the message will them that you sent them a message so you don't have to scroll through a long thread to figure out which ones are for you. Love that feature.
Very useful for collaborating with my coworkers

We've been using Glip for our inter-office business SMS service ever since it came bundled with RingCentral. In the beginning, it was very glitchy and several people couldn't sync mobile and desktop communications on Glip. Messages would be missed, which was a real problem. These days, it seems to work consistently and reliably. The desktop version still has some stability issues - particularly with video and audio (some of this is of course user error), but overall it's been working great for our team. As this is an app review, the app for iOS itself works great. But this app is integrated with a desktop version (we use PCs in the office) and our RingCentral VOIP phone system, and the overall communications platform for all modes still could use some additional refinement. Integration of RingCentral and Glip has improved significantly since the onset, but still has a ways to go before we're able to use one simple app for all of the functionality.
Easy to use, lots of features, integrates with Google and other apps
As people in our organization see the efficiency of the communication and collaboration they want in. It is intuitive and easy to get people added and up to speed.  It is also easy to customize.
Great, fast, and easy for employees to use for any type of communication.

title.label: Better alternative to Slack or BaseCamp.

content.label: This app is a decent. The desktop version is amazing.

I am using Glip for about 1 year. At the beginning I saw some bugs. Then I found web version of that App and... started to use in my company! We love these giffy/smiles funny things. Tasks and events help us to figure out thinga and manage our time. Wish you can make that faster. It has multiple amazing features so.... waiting for some performance boost! :) All the best!

title.label: Great way to keep in touch with staff

content.label: Sharing files and staying in contact has never been easier.
Glip really makes it easy to communicate with others, share files, have a task list etc and the mobile app just keeps getting better.
Moved to Glip from slack after our company moved to ring central. Excellent integration with google apps, task list. Very easy to use and search messages

I'm a consultant and have been using Glip for 2 years. I love using it for team and client communications. I've found that most project management tools are too clumsy for my client teams and so they wouldn't use it. However with Glip, my client use is nearly 100%. It handles everything I use tools like this for and with iOS notifications I'm always in the know and up to date. Great product with minimal issues.
Need to be able to add attachments to tasks and we need gifs in app too. Other than that, very clean and critical app for our team

I've asked them more than twice now about Gifs for the iOS from my phone. Nothing doing. This was over two months ago. Besides that, the app is great when it doesn't disconnect you from wi-if every 20 mins.

title.label: Love the Service App needs Tweeks

content.label: Love Glip as a desktop app but wish the same features were available in the mobile app like access to gifs files and links. It works well and doesn't crash so that's a bonus for on the go collaboration!
Great app, needs to add Apple Watch support and it will be 5 stars for me.

I'm general, we like Glip and use it to communicate with our clients. However, the most frustrating omission -- and one which may steer us back to using BaseCamp -- is that there is no threading of conversations. It's difficult to have relevant discussions with clients when you can't reply to a specific post. 

Another plus we would like is integration with DropBox so that any uploaded file can be automatically uploaded to a designated DripBox folder. Not critical, but would be nice.
The app is OK, but it's a pain in the neck that  it does not open with in ring central

title.label: Great task list and IM tool

content.label: Organizes IMs by task.  Super tool!  Works!

I use Glip with clients and find it a valuable platform for collaborating. It is helpful to get push notifications and emails when there are new posts, yet the conversation thread is easily viewed in the Glip app. It took us awhile to get used to how to access various features, but it is going well now.
Use it everyday
This app is far better than I expected. It does everything it should, and does it on every platform. We use it extensively throughout the company. Filled a need very well.
Just don't waste you're time
Love it. Especially the Glip application. Great tool for teams with projects for accountability and reliability.
This app works seamlessly with its desktop counterpart. It's easy to use and extremely intuitive.
I love this app!! Its been few years now, and our staff love it everyday

title.label: Best Tool in our Tool Belt - Our Ninja Weapon

content.label: As the CEO of a growing agency, I can say with confidence that Glip is the most effective tool in my tool belt. Glip has integrations with other project management tools that keep our communication and projects organized in one central place. We can organize with folders, sort and search, save links, create notes, add files, and even video chat directly from Glip. Not only is it our ninja weapon for efficiency, but our company culture even centers around Glip; we can even make custom emoji's! I've been with Glip for over 2 years and they continue to stay ahead of the curve. It's like they know the next thing I'm going to need and by the time I'm asking for it, it's being delivered! And their mobile app is incredibly useful! My only advice is that you truly take the time to discover how it can work for you. There's not a manual and there are so many different ways to accomplish the same thing. Navigate all the features and test them out!

Love using this app. Works perfect for my small business. To the team: could you please tweak some things to make the app more user friendly? More options like deleting conversations, Adding photos in tasks, etc. Thanks again!

title.label: Must Have For Design, Development, Marketing Agencies and tons more.

content.label:
We have been using Glip for a long time now, and just like us it keeps getting better with age. You wont find another project tool, design collaboration, task, tacking, communication no matter where you are. Never be out of the loop with your team.

Both team and clients begin using it and they love it and wouldnt think about using anything else today. Thanks for am awesome tool and allowing us to be more focused, less email, organized, and did I mention less email :-). Keep up the great work Glip team!

My team has been on glip for a few months and it's okay has some bugs and performance issues but for what it is it usually works. Best feature is send gif needs to improve search and add a code snip it but other than that is ok. We use to use slack but they are too expensive.
Great job guys. Much better than slack or Microsoft teams and we are an office 365 house. Would be nice to have video calling for everyone in the office even the people with no phone line.
Very useful companion to the desktop but is also good stand alone.

title.label: Takes collaboration to a new level

content.label:
I run a news website with ongoing tasks, schedules, assignments, managing multiple writers, and Glip has become an essential part of our workflow and communication. Keeping tasks organized, using groups for communication on different projects, and the notes function are the most helpful for us.
Definitely recommend this app.
I use this app constantly to maintain communications with colleagues and customers. I can send large documents and files through GLIP and do it all from my iPhone. Love this app.
Moved to Glip from skype and never looked back.  My Dev team loves Glip for collaboration.
